result.execSummary:
The defendant Leah Marie Lee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fail/Report to Jail (Misdemeanor), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.425(1r)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Def is given credit from August 10, 2015. 30 day jail sentence from 14CM235 is consecutive to this jail sentence. Huber allowed for work, child care, medical appointments and treatment.

records.addlTxt: 2:09  Defendant Leah Marie Lee in court with attorney Christopher R. Bub.  Defendant Leah Marie Lee in custody.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. OSullivan  Plead to Ct 1.   10 days jail sentence to be imposed. Credit since 8-10-15.  The 30 days conditional jail sentence is consecutive to the 10 day sentence.   Constitutional rights explained to defendant   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def  Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights  DEF PLEADS GUILTY  Facts are correct  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS  The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of the charge. Court orders  10 days jail with credit from 8-10-15.  After that sentence is served  the 30 days sentence on 14CM235 will begin.  Huber allowed for work, child care, medical appts, treatment

4:31 Defendant Leah Marie Lee in court  VIA VIDEO CONFERENCING FROM PCJ, in custody.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Christopher Bub appeared in court.  Def does not have a copy of the complaint. Court reads charging portion.   Constitutional rights explained to defendant.   Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def pleas not guilty.  Court rec's and enters. OSullivan: $2000 cash bond. Bub objects and requests signature bond.  Ms Lee addresses court. Court orders a $500 cash bond.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 04:30 pm.
